title: Alexander Alekhine
summary: Alexander Alekhine (Russian: Алекса́ндр Алекса́ндрович Але́хин, Aleksándr Aleksándrovich Alékhin; pronounced [ɐlʲɪkˈsandr ɐlʲɪkˈsandrəvʲɪtɕ ɐˈlʲexʲɪn];[note 1][note 2] October 31 [O.S. October 19] 1892 – March 24, 1946) was a Russian and French chess player and the fourth World Chess Champion, a title he held for two reigns.
